flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=52>>52 photos.
When Tim has 52 photos, then Paul has 52 + 10 photos = <<52+10=26>>26 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 52 photos + 26 photos = <<52+26=78>>78 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 78 photos = <<152-78=74>>74 photos.
#### 74

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 62, not 26. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
